item.title: Amid violent reprisals, Afghans fear the Taliban's 'amnesty' was empty
item.description: Reports suggest the Taliban are searching for, and allegedly killing, people they pledged to leave in peace.

item.title: Geronimo the alpaca killed as legal row ends
item.description: A destruction order is carried out on the alpaca that tested positive for bovine TB.

item.title: Fake Banksy NFT sold through artist's website for £244k
item.description: Duped buyer says he feels "burned" after apparent hack of Banksy website.

item.title: Covid-19: Ryanair predicts travel rebound and Mission: Impossible's Covid lawsuit
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Tuesday evening.

item.title: NHS blood tube shortage: Supplier ramps up imports
item.description: Becton Dickinson has announced it will deliver 9 million blood test tubes to the NHS this week.

item.title: R. Kelly trial: First male accuser testifies to sexual abuse
item.description: An unnamed man says the star promised fame in exchange for sex, while a female witness alleges rape.

item.title: Brent petrol murder: Man guilty of killing wife in arson attack
item.description: Damion Simmons doused Denise Keane-Simmons in petrol then set her on fire inside her home.

item.title: Deputy first minister tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: A meeting of the Stormont Executive on Wednesday to discuss restrictions has been postponed until next week.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Swimmer Reece Dunn sets world record to win third gold of Games
item.description: Reece Dunn sets a new world record to win his third gold medal of the Tokyo Paralympics, as the medals continue to flow for Great Britain on day seven.

item.title: Disabled girl, 10, in three-year wait for new wheelchair, says dad
item.description: The father of the severely disabled child is worried her back is being damaged as a result.

item.title: Naked Attraction London bus ads to be removed
item.description: The advert was criticised on social media as "tone deaf" with passengers at risk of sexual assault.

item.title: The best of British press photography
item.description: Images from an exhibition of the best 100 from members of the British Press Photographers' Association.

item.title: Dave Grohl performs with Nandi Bushell, 11, at Foo Fighters gig
item.description: Nandi Bushell joins the American rock band on stage in Los Angeles.

item.title: Women risking fines for feminism
item.description: A movement that started in Paris, has now spread into locations across the globe.

item.title: Para-athlete takes tornado kicks to Tokyo
item.description: For the first time, the Paralympic games will host a Para-Taekwondo competition.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Ellie Robinson's 'story of triumph not defeat'
item.description: Ellie Robinson says her fifth-place finish in the S6 butterfly final at the Tokyo Paralympics was "a story of triumph not defeat".

item.title: Milan fire: Flames engulf modern 20-storey block of flats
item.description: The tower is only 10 years old and questions are being asked about how the fire spread so dramatically.

item.title: Hurricane Ida: Striking pictures show storm sweeping Gulf Coast
item.description: Hurricane Ida made landfall on the US state of Louisiana, on the 16th anniversary of Hurricane Katrina.

item.title: Paramotor pilot shares pictures of John O'Groats-Land's End flight
item.description: Daniel Jones snaps aerial images from John O'Groats to Land's End while on a very personal mission.

item.title: Why teenagers are mentoring senior Met Police officers
item.description: Three teenagers have mentored a trio of the Met’s top women officers over the last six months.

item.title: Sarah Rainsford: My last report before Russian expulsion
item.description: The BBC's Moscow correspondent has spent much of her life in Russia. This is her final report there.

item.title: Theranos scandal: Who is Elizabeth Holmes and why is she on trial?
item.description: The former boss of blood testing company Theranos is accused of fraud and could face years in jail.

item.title: The remarkable rise of the independent councillors
item.description: A quiet revolution is taking place in England and Wales as independent councillors challenge big parties.

item.title: Can apps move the #MeToo movement forward?
item.description: Reporting sexual harassment at work is getting easier thanks to new technologies.

item.title: Nigerian students amass degrees to stay in Europe
item.description: Modupe Osunkoya enrolled on her third post-graduate degree because she says there are no jobs at home.

item.title: Back to school: How will schools be kept Covid-safe this term?
item.description: Pupils across the UK are preparing to return to school after the summer holidays.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Millions of children, including 16 and 17 year olds, are now being offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: England captain Kane has 'clear conscience' over Man City transfer saga
item.description: England captain Harry Kane says he has a "clear conscience" after a potential move to Manchester City from Tottenham Hotspur failed to materialise.

item.title: 'Sir Alex, this one is for you' - Ronaldo re-signs for Manchester United
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo says he is "back where I belong" at Manchester United and dedicates his return to the club to former boss Sir Alex Ferguson.

item.title: US Open 2021: Emma Raducanu wins on New York main-draw debut
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu again shows her talent and maturity on the Grand Slam stage as she eases to victory on her US Open main-draw debut.

item.title: Transfer Deadline Day: Daniel James' best Premier League goals for Manchester United
item.description: Watch some of Daniel James' best Premier League goals for Manchester United, as the Wales forward moves from Old Trafford to Leeds United.

item.title: Toyko Paralympics: Sarah Storey wins 16th gold after C5 time trial victory
item.description: Watch the moment Sarah Storey became Britain's joint-most successful Paralympic athlete, winning the women's C5 time trial to earn her 16th gold medal.

item.title: Afghanistan: How can the West stop terror bases?
item.description: The foreign secretary says the UK will fight ISIS by all means available - but what does that mean?

item.title: Afghanistan: 'Struggle to survive or race to escape' on streets of Kabul
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet reports from the Afghan capital, a day after the last US troops left.

item.title: What equipment was left behind by US forces?
item.description: As US troops took off from Kabul, they abandoned 73 aircraft - all disabled.

item.title: Liverpool man trapped in Afghanistan pleads for help
item.description: The Liverpool taxi driver travelled to the country about two weeks ago to help his family flee.

item.title: Afghanistan: How many refugees are there and where will they go?
item.description: Thousands of people are scrambling to flee Afghanistan after the Taliban took control of the country.

item.title: The last US soldier leaves Afghanistan
item.description: Major General Chris Donahue was last aboard the final flight before the Taliban took Kabul airport.

item.title: Left behind in Afghanistan: If I can’t get out, I’ll die
item.description: An Afghan who had authorisation to fly to the UK speaks to the BBC about his struggle to escape.

item.title: Afghanistan: Fleeing the Taliban into Pakistan and leaving dreams behind
item.description: The BBC speaks to Afghans fleeing the Taliban into Pakistan at the Chaman Spin Boldak border.

item.title: From Bush to Biden: One war, four US presidents on Afghanistan
item.description: Two decades of conflict in Afghanistan shaped the legacies of each of these commanders-in-chief.

item.title: Taliban are back - what next for Afghanistan?
item.description: As the Taliban take power after 20 years of conflict, what did the war achieve and what happens now?

item.title: Afghanistan: ‘A new chapter has begun’ says US
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken has been speaking about the end of America's withdrawal from Afghanistan.

item.title: John Simpson on Afghanistan: A country abandoned
item.description: As foreign forces end their 20-year campaign, our world affairs editor considers what has been achieved.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Afghanistan athlete Hossain Rasouli makes debut after evacuation
item.description: Afghanistan evacuee Hossain Rasouli finally gets his chance to compete at the Tokyo Paralympics - and his opponents can't "help but feel joy".

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Who are Great Britain's medal winners?
item.description: A list of the Great Britain medal winners from the Tokyo 2020 Paralympics.

item.title: Which country has won most golds?
item.description: Which country is leading the medal table for the Tokyo 2020 Paralympics? How are Great Britain getting on?

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: What you need to know about Paralympic classification
item.description: From KL1 to PT2 and F11 to SB6 - everything you need to know about classification at the Paralympic Games.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Sport-by-sport guide
item.description: Twenty-two sports will feature in the Tokyo Paralympics - find out more about them all here.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Eight Great Britain athletes to watch at Games
item.description: From the 'Weirwolf' to a potential swimming star, who are some of the Great Britain athletes hoping to shine at the Tokyo Paralympics?

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Eight global athletes to watch at Games
item.description: From the Blade Jumper to the dancing star and the Tik Tok influencer, meet some of the global athletes hoping to make an impact at the Tokyo Paralympics.

item.title: Afghanistan: Shukria Barakzai's whispered voice notes and dramatic escape
item.description: The desperate messages sent by Afghan politician Shukria Barakzai to a UK MP as the Taliban tried to hunt her down.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'undefeated' Panjshir Valley - an hour from Kabul
item.description: The Panjshir Valley has been a flashpoint in Afghanistan's turbulent history - now it's happening again.

item.title: Bilal Sarwary: 'The plane hit the tower and all our lives changed'
item.description: Afghan journalist Bilal Sarwary was selling carpets when 9/11 happened. From that day on, everything changed.

item.title: Shot in the head in Angola, left for dead, now a Wetherspoons star
item.description: Cesar Kimbirima fled Angola after being shot four times and spending five months in a coma.

item.title: Michael Knighton: The man who could have bought Man Utd for £10m but walked away
item.description: In August 1989, Michael Knighton celebrated his Manchester United takeover deal at Old Trafford. But the plotting against him had just begun.
